name: Rhodiola
summary: Rhodiola (Rhodiola rosea) is an adaptogenic herb traditionally used to reduce fatigue, enhance resilience to stress, and support mood and cognitive performance.
description: Rhodiola rosea is an adaptogenic plant native to cold regions of Europe and Asia. Its active compounds, such as rosavins and salidroside, are thought to modulate stress-response pathways, including the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, monoamine neurotransmitters, and mitochondrial function. It has been studied for its ability to reduce symptoms of fatigue, improve cognitive performance under stress, and support mood and anxiety disorders. While evidence suggests potential benefit in mild to moderate depression and stress-related fatigue, clinical data remain modest and heterogeneous.

metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for medical indications)

off_label_uses: Adjunctive therapy for mild to moderate depression
contraindications: Bipolar disorder (may trigger mood instability in some cases)
monitoring_required: Mood changes in individuals with psychiatric history
Blood pressure if combined with stimulants

items: Helps reduce fatigue and exhaustion during periods of stress
Supports resilience to physical and mental stress
May improve mild symptoms of depression and anxiety

sections.text: Rhodiola’s adaptogenic effects are thought to occur through modulation of the HPA axis, increased levels of serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine, and improved mitochondrial energy metabolism. Rosavins and salidroside are considered the primary bioactive compounds.

adult.typical: 200–600 mg/day of standardized extract (containing 3% rosavins, 1% salidroside)
adult.note: Usually taken in the morning to avoid insomnia.

sections.text: Effects on fatigue and stress may be noticed within days to weeks; mood support may require consistent use over several weeks.

serious: Possible mood destabilization in bipolar disorder

other: May cause overstimulation or insomnia if taken late in the day.
Caution in individuals with bipolar disorder or psychiatric instability.

items: Blood pressure if at risk for hypertension

sections.lactation: Not recommended due to limited data
sections.geriatrics: Generally safe at standard doses; monitor for interactions

sections.text: No tapering required; may discontinue without withdrawal symptoms.

items: Considered one of the best-studied adaptogens, though evidence is still modest compared to conventional treatments.
May enhance both physical and mental endurance, especially under stress.
Standardized extracts are preferred to ensure consistency of active compounds.
